2016-01-30.lead_paragraph: The central bank will charge commercial depositors to hold money in its vaults — a move meant to stimulate the economy amid global market turmoil.
2016-01-30.abstract: Policy makers at Bank of Japan approve measure that would cut interest rates below zero in order to encourage lending and bolster lackluster economy; Japan follows other central banks, reflecting global trouble from slowing growth in China to low oil prices and sluggish international trade.

headline.main: Bank of Japan, in a Surprise, Adopts Negative Interest Rate
headline.print_headline: Bank of Japan Surprises by Adopting a Negative Rate

byline.contributor: Hisako Ueno contributed reporting.

2016-01-31.snippet: Millions of people are still driving vehicles with Takata airbags that may pose a lethal danger because they have not been repaired or, in some cases, even recalled....
2016-01-31.lead_paragraph: Millions of people are still driving vehicles with Takata airbags that may pose a lethal danger because they have not been repaired or, in some cases, even recalled.
2016-01-31.abstract: Vast number of faulty Takata-manufactured airbags have not been repaired or recalled over decade since first confirmed rupture, posing threat to tens of millions of drivers and passengers; drivers report long waits for vehicle repairs and refusal of automakers to provide loaner cars in interim; National Highway Traffic Safety Admin does not have authority to order people to stop driving cars and has not issued any advisory to do so.

headline.main: Takata’s Faulty Airbags Still Exact Toll as Recalls Lag
headline.print_headline: Faulty Airbags Still Exact Toll as Recalls Lag

2016-01-31.lead_paragraph: Genetically engineered mosquitoes are among the cutting-edge weapons being tested against diseases, even as some experts say old-fashioned tools like DDT may be worth discussing.
2016-01-31.abstract: Mosquitoes genetically engineered to produce offspring that die soon after birth are being tested as weapon against Zika virus sweeping Latin America; experts say standard methods of insecticide and removing standing water where mosquitoes breed have proved inadequate to daunting task.

headline.main: New Weapon to Fight Zika: The Mosquito
